meanings.definition: A person or thing that fractures.
meanings.sent1: The skilled fracturer mended the broken vase with care.
meanings.sent2: The fracturer examined the cracked wall to determine the extent of the damage.
meanings.sent3: The little toy robot claimed to be a fracturer of hearts, but it was just a silly toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a fracturer, breaking down the barriers around his heart.
meanings.sent5: In the world of puzzles, the fracturer was the one who could put everything back together.

meanings.definition: To cause a fracture in something.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to fracturer the delicate glass when handling it.
meanings.sent2: The impact of the fall was enough to fracturer the bone in his arm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to enjoy trying to fracturer the nuts with its tiny teeth.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake seemed to fracturer the very foundation of the old building.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise was enough to fracturer the silence of the night.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old bridge began to fracturer due to the harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent2: The ice started to fracturer as the temperature rose above freezing.
meanings.sent3: The cookie was so crunchy that it seemed to fracturer with every bite.
meanings.sent4: His heart began to fracturer when he heard the news of her departure.
meanings.sent5: The relationship between the two countries started to fracturer under the pressure of conflicting interests.
